Key.Original: Welcome to Zombie Framework!%1If you're new to this gamemode, you should check out the Getting Started guide on your map journal.
Zombies are being fought off by soldiers here. Provide support!
A few groups of demons are roaming this area. Clear them out!
This area is being guarded by raiders. Take them out!
This area has been infested with zombies. Clear them out!
A military research building has been found containing intel. Secure it!
We have been tasked to fight off zombies in this region.
A group of civilians have been taking shelter from the apocalypse. Save them!

ACE is being used by this mission. Here are some basic tips if you are not familiar with ACE:
- Hold [Ctrl+Windows] to show self-interactions
- Hover over an interaction and release to perform it
- Hold [Windows] to interact with players and objects
- If your weapon jams, you can unjam it by pressing [Shift+R]

If enabled, your weapon may overheat from firing too frequently. Having suppressors attached to your gun will cause it to heat up much more quickly. It is recommended to remove your suppressor when un-needed, or bring a canteen / water bottle to cool down your gun when needed.

In ACE, stamina management is critical to surviving in combat against zombies. If you sprint or move at low ready too often, you will quickly burn through your stamina, and running completely out of stamina will force you to walk.
To preserve stamina, lower your gun whenever possible by pressing [2xLeftCtrl], and also stand up so you can jog with the least effort. Carrying fewer items will also reduce the stamina needed to maneuver around.

There are various vehicle service stations around base. Once you are parked beside one, you will need to exit the vehicle to service it.
Refuel: Walk to the gas station / fuel container and interact with it to grab the fuel pump.
Rearm: Walk to the vehicle rearm container and interact with it to rearm your vehicle.
Repair: Grab a toolkit and interact with your vehicle to perform a "Full Repair".

At a rearm station, ACE can be used to replace weapon pylons on an existing aircraft:
1. Grab a toolkit.
2. Park the aircraft near a vehicle rearm station.
3. Exit the vehicle, interact with it, and select "Configure Pylons".
4. Choose the pylons you want and click "OK" to start replacing pylons.
5. Once complete, walk to the rearm station and interact with it to load the modified pylons with their corresponding munitions.
When you purchase a vehicle from a vendor, you will be given the keys for that vehicle. To unlock it: walk up to the vehicle, interact with it, and select "Unlock vehicle".

Using the ACE interaction menu, you can share points with other players to help them purchase more expensive items. When interacting with a player, you should see the options to share your points in increments.

This mission was developed by thegamecracks and ZenoVoid as part of the Warriors Haven Gaming community. You can find our development work on GitHub!

https://github.com/Warriors-Haven-Gaming/Zombie-Framework

This is an open world mission where you will be completing objectives across %1 to fight off the apocalypse.

Near your spawn should be a whiteboard that shows your statistics across game restarts. For server admins, this also allows them to perform administrative actions for the mission.

On the border of the map, you will see the amount of points you have measured in BP. This currency persists across restarts every time the mission is saved, which may be automatic if autosaving is enabled (the default), or otherwise manually saved by the server admin.

You gain points whenever you kill zombies or hostiles, or complete missions. As you accumulate points, your points multiplier also increases, allowing you to gain points more quickly. This points multiplier gets reset whenever you die or return to base. External factors can also affect your points multiplier, such as whether it is night time.

Shopkeepers at base can be used to purchase various items and services using the points you've earned, including vehicles and AI recruits. Kills achieved by recruits you've purchased will count towards your kill count and point rewards.

Safezones are marked on map in solid blue, indicating areas where zombies will not spawn in. Some missions produce safezones upon completion, but may only last for a certain period of time before disappearing. Note that safezones do not prevent zombies from entering them.

Zombies and Demons's infection module is enabled, meaning that zombie hits have a chance to cause infection. This infection will progress until it takes over motor functions, at which point you become a zombie. You can recover from infection by taking antivirus medications or by going through a decontamination shower.
You have reached the recruit limit of %1.
The vehicle spawn is currently obstructed.
Something went wrong with the purchase.
You cannot purchase %1! It requires %2, but you only have %3.
You cannot share %1 to this player as you only have %2.

Welcome back!

You earned %1 in this trip, reaching a multiplier of %2x.
You have shared %1 with %2! You have %3 left.
You were given %1 from %2! You now have %3.
You have refunded %1 for %2! You now have %3.
Your %1 was refunded to you at %2 for %3.
You have received ACE keys to unlock your %1.
Someone needs to stay near the intel laptop!
Intel has been downloaded! Time for you to move out!
Only your group leader can escort units!
Are you sure you want to save?
Are you sure you want to reset the current save?
You need %1 first aid kits to self-revive! (%2 missing)
Are you sure you want to enable autosaving?
Are you sure you want to disable autosaving?
The base multiplier applied to BP earned.\nNote that some income sources are exempt from multipliers.
The amount your BP multiplier will increase as the map becomes dark, especially at night.
The amount your BP multiplier will increase per BP earned.\nMeasured in thousandths of a percent, i.e. 5 means +0.005% per BP earned.

The amount your BP multiplier will increase per BP earned while outside of vehicles.\nThis stacks on top of the normal multiplier increase.\nMeasured in thousandths of a percent, i.e. 5 means +0.005% per BP earned.
The maximum time in seconds to refund a recent purchase.
The minimum time in seconds for purchase protection.\nAfter this, insurance will decrease to 0% at the maximum time.
The maximum time in seconds for purchase protection.\nAfter the minimum time, insurance will decrease to 0% at this time.
The maximum percentage of the purchase's original value covered by purchase protection.
Vehicles retain insurance after being brought outside their safezone.
Allow friendly fire damage from purchased recruits.
Allow friendly fire damage in base safezones.
The time in seconds at which dropped loot will be deleted.
The max distance from any player before mission objects can be deleted.
The max distance from any player before hidden objects (usually terrain) can be revealed.
The max distance from any player before a zombie can be garbage collected.
Save your loadout after closing the arsenal.
Temporarily lock purchased vehicles to the owner.
When ACE is loaded, replace the one-time unlock action with inventory keys.
The minimum number of main missions allowed.\nIf there are fewer main missions than this, the gamemode will spawn more missions up to the maximum.\nSet to 0 to disable main missions completely.
The maximum number of main missions to spawn.
The minimum number of side missions allowed.\nIf there are fewer side missions than this, the gamemode will spawn more missions up to the maximum.\nSet to 0 to disable side missions completely.
The maximum number of side missions to spawn.
Play various music tracks in a loop indefinitely. Requires Music volume to be unmuted.
The maximum number of recruits that can be commanded per player group.
The name of the save to use. This can be used for storing multiple saves.
The frequency at which the gamemode autosaves in seconds.\nAutosaving must be manually toggled using the physical, admin board prop.
The time in seconds to wait before able to self-revive.
The duration in seconds needed to hold the self-revive action.
The number of first aid kits required to self-revive.
The duration in seconds needed to unflip vehicles.
The maximum vehicle angle allowed to be unflipped.\n100% is straight up (always allowed), 0% is at least perpendicular to terrain, and -100% is exactly straight down.
The distance in metres to search around the vehicle for an empty position.\nHigh values may worsen performance.
Spawn vehicle wrecks along roads as obstacles.
The approximate distance in metres between vehicle wrecks.\nCAUTION: Lowering this can dramatically increase the number of wrecks spawned across the map.
The density multiplier for wrecks near a town.
The maximum distance from a road to a town to apply the town factor.\nThe town factor is applied linearly based on the distance to the town's center.
Vehicle wrecks will be oriented to roughly match their side of the road.
Allow vehicle wrecks to spawn in safezones.\nSince wrecks are spawned at the start of each game, this does not apply to dynamically generated safezones.
An array of wreck classnames to spawn as simple objects.
The frequency in seconds at which the loitering zombie threshold is updated.\nWhen there are more zombies than the current threshold, ambient zombies will stop spawning to save performance.
The minimum threshold allowed for loitering zombies.\nIncrease this for more ambient zombies.
The maximum threshold allowed for loitering zombies. Takes priority over minimum.
The number of zombies to add to the threshold for each connected player.
A random number of zombies to add to the threshold every time it is updated.\nThis can make hordes randomly appear more or less frequently.
The maximum altitude in metres that players can trigger loitering zombies.
Allow loitering zombies to spawn inside safezones. Mission hordes can spawn regardless of this setting.
The speed in km/h at which loitering zombies will always trigger.\nStacks with other factors.
The chance increase of loitering zombies when in a vehicle with a running engine.\nStacks with other factors.
The chance increase of loitering zombies when in the dark with a vehicle's headlights on.\nStacks with other factors.
The chance increase of loitering zombies when in the dark with a weapon flashlight on.\nStacks with other factors.
The chance increase of loitering zombies when near a town.\nStacks with other factors.
The maximum distance in metres from a town considered for loitering zombies. Lower values may improve performance.
The radius in metres from the center of a town where the town factor is highest.
The minimum chance of loitering zombies spawning.
The faction that zombies will spawn as. Using OPFOR means zombies will not attack regular enemies.\nChanging this will not retroactively apply to existing zombies.
The chance that a zombie will drop a First Aid Kit.
The chance that a zombie will drop Antivirus Pills.
The chance that a non-soldier zombie will drop magazines.
The chance that a soldier zombie will drop magazines.
The maximum number of magazines that a non-soldier zombie can drop.
The maximum number of magazines that a soldier zombie can drop.
The chance that a non-soldier zombie will drop a weapon.
The chance that a soldier zombie will drop a weapon.
An array of weapon classnames to randomly select from.
The maximum number of magazines to drop alongside the weapon.
Determines how high zombies can jump.
Determines how high demons can jump.
The delay in seconds between zombie attacks. Does not apply to demons.
The distance in metres that zombie attacks can reach.
The damage dealt to humans as a percentage.
The damage dealt to cars as a percentage.
The damage dealt to aircraft as a percentage.
The damage dealt to tanks as a percentage.
The chance a victim will become infected if attacked by a zombie.
The percentage of infection applied to the victim each minute.
Infected units can show symptoms or be unknowingly infected.
The sound infected units will make if they die from infection.
Duration in seconds the consumer is immune to infection and its symptoms.
The speed multiplier for slow zombies.
The speed multiplier for medium zombies.
The speed multiplier for fast zombies.
The speed multiplier for spider zombies.
The speed multiplier for crawler zombies.
The speed multiplier for walker zombies.
The speed multiplier for player zombies.
The zombie type that victims will resurrect into.
The time it takes after the victim has died to resurrect.
Forces the victims to resurrect with the victims uniform.\nThis stops the custom animations from working.
Defines what weapon type is required for decapitation.
Allows zombie eyes to glow red.
Allows demon eyes to glow red.
Defines if headshots are needed to kill zombies.
Allows zombies and targets to bleed when hit, injured or infected.
Allow idle zombies to make sounds.
Allow attacking zombies to make sounds.
Allow zombies to make sounds when jumping.
Defines how much damage zombies can take.
Defines how much damage demons can take.
There is not enough space around the vehicle to unflip it!
